h2.div: A message from the superintendent's office

div.p: The Gallatin R-V School District will remain closed through April 24th, 2020, and classes are scheduled to resume on Monday, April 27th. Gallatin R-V administration will continue to monitor the rapidly evolving health conditions pertaining to the COVID-19 virus and this date will be subject to re-evaluation based upon current information from health officials. The Gallatin R-V School District will be on Spring Break from April 10th-April 17th, 2020. This break will be treated as a regular session school break, and there will be no school work or assignments required during this time frame. Food service will not operate on Friday April 10th, however, food delivery will resume on Monday, April 13th, 2020 and continue as scheduled for those who signed up for this service. Have a great day and enjoy your Spring Break. Stay healthy everyone!

div.small: The Gallatin R-V School District complies with all federal and state laws prohibiting discrimination, including Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972 and Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1974 and the American Disabilities Act (ADA). It is the policy of the school district that no person, on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, age, or handicap, shall be discriminated against in employment, educational programs and activities or admissions. Inquiries or complaints concerning the Gallatin R-V School Districts compliance with the regulations implementing Title II, Title VI, Title IX, Section 504 or the American Disabilities Act (ADA) may be directed to: Superintendent's Office: 602 South Olive Street, Gallatin, MO. 64640
